Rent.definition: a return made by a tenant or occupant of real property to the owner for possession and use thereof ;esp

1 a.definition: a return made by a tenant or occupant of real property to the owner for possession and use thereofa sum of money agreed upon between a landlord and tenant for the use of real property

sub_terms.b: a contract by which one party conveys to another to hold as owner a tract of land or other immovable property in perpetuity in exchange for payment of an annual sum or quantity of fruits
sub_terms.c: the amount paid by a hirer of personal property to the owner for the use thereof
sub_terms.d: a royalty under a mineral lease

2.definition: to take and hold under an agreement to pay rent

2 a.definition: to obtain use and possession of a place or property in exchange for rent

sub_terms.b: to allow the possession and use of property in exchange for rent
